author: Joelle Eberhart
text: 'OVERPRICED AND THEY ADD SUGAR\nThey were going to charge me $17 for a small bowl üò° $1 charge for every substitute and if I tried to make it from scratch it would be more $$. $4-5 cheaper elsewhere for a 24oz (larger) bowl'

text: 'There a Branch A√ßa√≠ place. They don‚Äôt have most things real a√ßa√≠ places have and their a√ßa√≠ and fruit taste very artificial. It‚Äôs nasty. I would try to find a more authentic a√ßa√≠ place. Oh and usually bowls are like $10 they charged me $16 and it for what? It wasn‚Äôt good.'

text: 'I ordered 2 Electric Mermaid bowel first time

text: "The nica bowl was really good and my son had the jetty. Our first time at the Hoboken location and the staff was very nice. It was 88¬∞ today so why not grab a bowl? Plus we were at the pier so that's a plus."

author: Aaliyah Suarez
text: 'Coconut and Banana bowls are a HIT!!!!'

author: Mariana Musharbash
text: "The Hoboken location is terrible I gave this place many chances and have walked out dissapointed everytime. Awful customer service
column5: never puts enough granola and my fruit was rotten when I got it. As I complained I got a dirty look and they didn't replace the bowl just picked out the sour fruit. I've been to many Playa Bowls and have never had any issues. This location is the absolute worst which is sad since its the closest to my house."

author: anna novash
text: "Im obsessed with Playa bowl especially the Pure Vida but let me tell you the one in Hoboken is the absolute worst one to go to. The one in Belmar is the best then after that would be in Summit. Here in Hoboken they barely put enough granola and the overall taste and experience is awful. The one in Summit you will get a beautiful bowl with a great amount of everything including a thick layer of granola. The fruit is as fresh as can be
column5: there's no code in the bathroom and the whole customer service experience is great. Im done with you Hoboken Playa. üëã"

author: Namankita Rana
text: 'Great bowl. Would come again. ü•≥'

author: Christian Farrell
text: 'Yum'

author: Thomas Kielich
text: "Ugh
column5: I'm addicted to this place.\n\nHonestly
column6: the acai bowls (or go with one of the other bases!) and smoothies are the way to go. I think they have some other items on the menu but I can't really speak to it.\n\nBut seriously
column7: this fruit blast is so good. And with toppings like nuts
column12: minus one star for the tables being dirty more often than not (and those rounded surfboard tables look cool but are a p.i.t.a. to eat off of) this place is a 5-star option otherwise!"

author: Z R
text: 'The bowls are delicious. But when you visit the Hoboken location
column5: you need to wait almost a half an hour from when you place your order‚Äî almost every time i‚Äôve visited. The line is always extremely long and the people working are in NO rush to get people their food. Every time i‚Äôm in line
column6: people always leave because of the wait. That‚Äôs business and money that Playa Bowl loses because of the sloth-like pace the employees work at. If any upper management is hopefully reading this
column7: this location really needs to pick up the pace and hire a few more people per shift. Typically
column8: there is one person running the cash register & smoothie machine
column9: one putting toppings on the bowls
column10: and one in the back. All of whom are moving at a glacial pace.  Not enough for the demand. There never appears to be a manager managing anyone behind the counter overseeing employees. On a busy day
column11: the customers become frustrated as 20 of us wait for an a√ßa√≠ bowl. You can see it in everyone‚Äôs faces.\n\nAgain
column13: but the customer service is god awful.  It‚Äôs a shame because it really hinders the entire experience. By the time I get my bowl
column14: I‚Äôm extremely frustrated.\n\nI‚Äôm currently waiting in the store as I write this
column15: and have been waiting for a half an hour for my bowl
column16: and it just came out wrong. I‚Äôm not even going to say anything because I dont want to wait another half hour
column17: I have things to do today!  My post is now that much more validated. Ugh.'

text: 'Pricey but nice

text: 'The fresh ginger and carrot juice drink was great.  Knocked my flu right out!'

text: 'So yummy! Came in on a recommendation of a friend and so glad they did! Loved it.  Flavors spot on and hearty.  Great selection of bowls smoothies and  juices.  Fun vibe in the atmosphere.  Staff were super friendly and patient with helping me navigate the menu.  Portions were a good size as well.'

author: Briana
text: 'The poke is delicious. It‚Äôs super fresh and the salmon is sushi grade. We got the salmon avocado bowl and it was just great. Giving 4 stars because you don‚Äôt get enough protein for the price. Tip: for an extra dollar or two

author: Angela Reynoso
text: '3 stars because:\n\n1. It was 70% rice
column5: 20% veggies
column6:
10% protein.
2. It was pricey for how the bowl is structured.

The food is good
column8: but because of the amount of rice and the little protein I had to give it 3 stars.\n\nI would pay this price for much less rice and more protein.'

text: 'Big variety of bowls and smoothie

author: Roman Nemchenko
text: 'Great food and overall selection negated by 30 min wait on my last three visits with barely anyone in the store.  Needs stronger store managers asap.'

author: Malavika Muralidharan
text: "Nice and cozy interior. They even have outdoor seating. Nutella Acai Bowl was great
column5: I got an additional topping of peanut butter for $0.50 - made it even better. Also
column6: LOVED the granola!! It is pricey though - my bowl with the topping
column7: taxes and tip came to about $14. I'll probably only go back if I have an Acai bowl craving late during the day since I know a place that serves some really good Acai bowl for $6 for breakfast."

author: Julissa Ruiz
text: "So happy that Playa Bowls has made a new home in Hoboken! Such a great team and chill vibe. Beautiful new store and amazing options to choose from. Staff is super helpful! Ask for a sample if you're curious about any bases. The Kale bowls are to die for !"

author: Helena Cunat
text: 'Hi guys
column5: I think I found my new favorite place to go on my break. Playa bowls is the perfect spot if your looking for a healthy
column7: and energizing snack or meal. They got just the right portion to keep you going throughout the day!!! Yummmy'
